sentences.english: Had the policemen arrived immediately, the criminal would have been caught.
sentences.chinese: 若是警察立刻到，就会抓获罪犯。

sentences.english: The corrupt official received a jail term of 10 years for the jerry-built project.
sentences.chinese: 这名贪官因为“豆腐渣”工程而获罪10年。

sentences.english: They were found guilty of possessing petrol bombs.
sentences.chinese: 他们被发现私藏汽油弹而获罪。

definition: to execute the whole family and confiscate their property
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
(of an official) to lose one's job
an execution/to put sb to death
to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
